template.name: Docker Cluster Manager
template.description: A Zabbix Templates that reads Swarm Manager Information about nodes and services (and soon Stacks) and create host prototypes about em.

item.name: Node Manageability
item.description: Get the Reachability status of a node. If the docker in a host is stopped or in a error state, the node become 'unreachable'.

item.name: Node Availability
item.description:
Verify the state of operation of a node. Can be active, drain or paused. For more information take a loot at:
https://docs.docker.com/engine/swarm/manage-nodes/

item.name: Node Role
item.description: Verify if a node is Manager or a Worker.

item.name: Service Type
item.description: Service can be of two types: replicated (default, with replicas spread among the cluster) or global (1 replica on each node of the cluster).

item.name: Service Running Replicas
item.description: Number of total tasks running. If the number of tasks is less than the total number it indicates that some services are running optimally or not running at all.

item.name: Service Total Replicas
item.description: Number of total replicas configured for a Service.

item.name: CPU Percent Usage
item.params: (last("docker.container.stats[{HOST.HOST}, cpu_stats.cpu_usage.total_usage]") - last("docker.container.stats[{HOST.HOST}, precpu_stats.cpu_usage.total_usage]")) / (last("docker.container.stats[{HOST.HOST}, cpu_stats.system_cpu_usage]") - last("docker.container.stats[{HOST.HOST}, precpu_stats.system_cpu_usage]")) * 100
item.description:
Calculate CPU Percentage use. Based on:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/30271942/get-docker-container-cpu-usage-as-percentage

item.name: CPU Total Usage (Needed for calculated Item)
CPU System Usage (Needed for calculated Item)
Pre-CPU Total Usage (Needed for calculated Item)
Pre-CPU System Usage (Needed for calculated Item)

discovery_rule.name: Docker Containers
discovery_rule.description: Discover all containers on a docker server.

trigger.name: Container memory usage over 70% of its limit
trigger.description: If the used memory is greater than 70% of the containers memory limit, it alarms.

trigger.name: Container State different of "Running"
trigger.description: Trigger if the container isn't running.

trigger.name: Less Than 50% of the replicas working for the Service {HOST.HOST}
trigger.description: If less than 50% of the replicas of a service are down, performance problems can occur.

dependency.name: Service Not Working - No Instance Active for the Service {HOST.NAME}

trigger.name: Service Not Working - No Instance Active for the Service {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: If no replica is active for a given service, so it should be out of combat.

trigger.name: Serviço do Docker não está rodando em {HOST.NAME}
